00056 #include <openssl/opensslconf.h>
00057 
00058 #ifndef HEADER_E_OS2_H
00059 #define HEADER_E_OS2_H
00060 
00061 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00062 extern "C" {
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 /******************************************************************************
00066  * Detect operating systems.  This probably needs completing.
00067  * The result is that at least one OPENSSL_SYS_os macro should be defined.
00068  * However, if none is defined, Unix is assumed.
00069  **/
00070 
00071 #define OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00072 
00073 /* ----------------------- Macintosh, before MacOS X ----------------------- */
00074 #if defined(__MWERKS__) && defined(macintosh) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_MAC)
00075 # undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00076 # define OPENSSL_SYS_MACINTOSH_CLASSIC
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 /* ---------------------- Microsoft operating systems ---------------------- */
00080 
00081 /* The 16 bit environments are pretty straightforward */
00082 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_WIN16) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_MSDOS)
00083 # undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00084 # define OPENSSL_SYS_MSDOS
00085 #endif
00086 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_WIN16)
00087 # undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00088 # define OPENSSL_SYS_WIN16
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 /* For 32 bit environment, there seems to be the CygWin environment and then
00092    all the others that try to do the same thing Microsoft does... */
00093 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_UWIN)
00094 # undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00095 # define OPENSSL_SYS_WIN32_UWIN
00096 #else
00097 # if defined(__CYGWIN32__) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_CYGWIN32)
00098 #  undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00099 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_WIN32_CYGWIN
00100 # else
00101 #  if defined(_WIN32) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_WIN32)
00102 #   undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00103 #   define OPENSSL_SYS_WIN32
00104 #  endif
00105 #  if defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_WINNT)
00106 #   undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00107 #   define OPENSSL_SYS_WINNT
00108 #  endif
00109 #  if defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_WINCE)
00110 #   undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00111 #   define OPENSSL_SYS_WINCE
00112 #  endif
00113 # endif
00114 #endif
00115 
00116 /* Anything that tries to look like Microsoft is "Windows" */
00117 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WIN16) || defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WIN32) || defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WINNT) || defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WINCE)
00118 # undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00119 # define OPENSSL_SYS_WINDOWS
00120 # ifndef OPENSSL_SYS_MSDOS
00121 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_MSDOS
00122 # endif
00123 #endif
00124 
00125 /* DLL settings.  This part is a bit tough, because it's up to the application
00126    implementor how he or she will link the application, so it requires some
00127    macro to be used. */
00128 #ifdef OPENSSL_SYS_WINDOWS
00129 # ifndef OPENSSL_OPT_WINDLL
00130 #  if defined(_WINDLL) /* This is used when building OpenSSL to indicate that
00131                           DLL linkage should be used */
00132 #   define OPENSSL_OPT_WINDLL
00133 #  endif
00134 # endif
00135 #endif
00136 
00137 /* -------------------------------- OpenVMS -------------------------------- */
00138 #if defined(__VMS) || defined(VMS) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_VMS)
00139 # undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00140 # define OPENSSL_SYS_VMS
00141 # if defined(__DECC)
00142 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_VMS_DECC
00143 # elif defined(__DECCXX)
00144 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_VMS_DECC
00145 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_VMS_DECCXX
00146 # else
00147 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_VMS_NODECC
00148 # endif
00149 #endif
00150 
00151 /* --------------------------------- OS/2 ---------------------------------- */
00152 #if defined(__EMX__) || defined(__OS2__)
00153 # undef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00154 # define OPENSSL_SYS_OS2
00155 #endif
00156 
00157 /* --------------------------------- Unix ---------------------------------- */
00158 #ifdef OPENSSL_SYS_UNIX
00159 # if defined(linux) || defined(__linux__) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_LINUX)
00160 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_LINUX
00161 # endif
00162 # ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_MPE
00163 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_MPE
00164 # endif
00165 # ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_SNI
00166 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_SNI
00167 # endif
00168 # ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_ULTRASPARC
00169 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_ULTRASPARC
00170 # endif
00171 # ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_NEWS4
00172 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_NEWS4
00173 # endif
00174 # ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_MACOSX
00175 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_MACOSX
00176 # endif
00177 # ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_MACOSX_RHAPSODY
00178 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_MACOSX_RHAPSODY
00179 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_MACOSX
00180 # endif
00181 # ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_SUNOS
00182 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_SUNOS
00183 #endif
00184 # if defined(_CRAY) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_CRAY)
00185 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_CRAY
00186 # endif
00187 # if defined(_AIX) || defined(OPENSSL_SYSNAME_AIX)
00188 #  define OPENSSL_SYS_AIX
00189 # endif
00190 #endif
00191 
00192 /* ------------------------------- VxWorks --------------------------------- */
00193 #ifdef OPENSSL_SYSNAME_VXWORKS
00194 # define OPENSSL_SYS_VXWORKS
00195 #endif
00196 
00197 /**
00198  * That's it for OS-specific stuff
00199  *****************************************************************************/
00200 
00201 
00202 /* Specials for I/O an exit */
00203 #ifdef OPENSSL_SYS_MSDOS
00204 # define OPENSSL_UNISTD_IO <io.h>
00205 # define OPENSSL_DECLARE_EXIT extern void exit(int);
00206 #else
00207 # define OPENSSL_UNISTD_IO OPENSSL_UNISTD
00208 # define OPENSSL_DECLARE_EXIT /* declared in unistd.h */
00209 #endif
00210 
00211 /* Definitions of OPENSSL_GLOBAL and OPENSSL_EXTERN, to define and declare
00212    certain global symbols that, with some compilers under VMS, have to be
00213    defined and declared explicitely with globaldef and globalref.
00214    Definitions of OPENSSL_EXPORT and OPENSSL_IMPORT, to define and declare
00215    DLL exports and imports for compilers under Win32.  These are a little
00216    more complicated to use.  Basically, for any library that exports some
00217    global variables, the following code must be present in the header file
00218    that declares them, before OPENSSL_EXTERN is used:
00219 
00220    #ifdef SOME_BUILD_FLAG_MACRO
00221    # undef OPENSSL_EXTERN
00222    # define OPENSSL_EXTERN OPENSSL_EXPORT
00223    #endif
00224 
00225    The default is to have OPENSSL_EXPORT, OPENSSL_IMPORT and OPENSSL_GLOBAL
00226    have some generally sensible values, and for OPENSSL_EXTERN to have the
00227    value OPENSSL_IMPORT.
00228 */
00229 
00230 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYS_VMS_NODECC)
00231 # define OPENSSL_EXPORT globalref
00232 # define OPENSSL_IMPORT globalref
00233 # define OPENSSL_GLOBAL globaldef
00234 #elif defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WINDOWS) && defined(OPENSSL_OPT_WINDLL)
00235 # define OPENSSL_EXPORT extern _declspec(dllexport)
00236 # define OPENSSL_IMPORT extern _declspec(dllimport)
00237 # define OPENSSL_GLOBAL
00238 #else
00239 # define OPENSSL_EXPORT extern
00240 # define OPENSSL_IMPORT extern
00241 # define OPENSSL_GLOBAL
00242 #endif
00243 #define OPENSSL_EXTERN OPENSSL_IMPORT
00244 
00245 /* Macros to allow global variables to be reached through function calls when
00246    required (if a shared library version requvres it, for example.
00247    The way it's done allows definitions like this:
00248 
00249     // in foobar.c
00250     OPENSSL_IMPLEMENT_GLOBAL(int,foobar) = 0;
00251     // in foobar.h
00252     OPENSSL_DECLARE_GLOBAL(int,foobar);
00253     #define foobar OPENSSL_GLOBAL_REF(foobar)
00254 */
00255 #ifdef OPENSSL_EXPORT_VAR_AS_FUNCTION
00256 # define OPENSSL_IMPLEMENT_GLOBAL(type,name) static type _hide_##name; \
00257         type *_shadow_##name(void) { return &_hide_##name; } \
00258         static type _hide_##name
00259 # define OPENSSL_DECLARE_GLOBAL(type,name) type *_shadow_##name(void)
00260 # define OPENSSL_GLOBAL_REF(name) (*(_shadow_##name()))
00261 #else
00262 # define OPENSSL_IMPLEMENT_GLOBAL(type,name) OPENSSL_GLOBAL type _shadow_##name
00263 # define OPENSSL_DECLARE_GLOBAL(type,name) OPENSSL_EXPORT type _shadow_##name
00264 # define OPENSSL_GLOBAL_REF(name) _shadow_##name
00265 #endif
00266 
00267 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00268 }
00269 #endif
00270 #endif
